articles.title: Anker’s X1 Pro shouldn’t exist, but I’m so glad it does - The Verge
articles.description: Anker’s Soundcore Nebula X1 Pro is a 400W Dolby Atmos party speaker combined with a very bright 4K, nearly-silent projector running Google TV.

articles.title: Why There's Simply No Need For A Password Manager Anymore - bgr.com
articles.description: With OS-level password managers, passkeys, and biometric authentication technology, there's no longer much need for third-party password managers.

articles.title: Microsoft gaming chief Phil Spencer steps down after 38 years with company - Ars Technica
articles.description: Microsoft CoreAI exec Asha Sharma will take over in surprise executive shake-up.

articles.title: Fury over Discord’s age checks explodes after shady Persona test in UK - Ars Technica
articles.description: Persona confirmed all age-check data from Discord's UK test was deleted.

articles.title: Apple's Low-Cost Colorful MacBook: All the Rumors - MacRumors
articles.description: Apple has been developing a more affordable version of the MacBook, and it's rumored to be launching in under two weeks. This is going to be one...

articles.title: Android malware is now using Gemini AI to adapt in real time (Updated: Google statement) - Android Authority
articles.description: Researchers say PromptSpy is the first Android malware to use generative AI during execution, querying Gemini to stay on a device.
